ygData.subject: Re: Iron Raptor
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Watching through sad optics, Prowl looks at Iron Raptor as she stands up, sopporting her. He could feel the emotions coming from her, confusion, surprise,

From: Yanshosh@...

::Prowl::

Watching through sad optics, Prowl looks at Iron Raptor as she stands 
up, sopporting her. He could feel the emotions coming from her, 
confusion, surprise, among many others, right before he heard her 
voice.

Prowl opens his mouth to reply, the whole situation suddenly very 
clear to him. He had killed them, there was no denying that. His 
thoughts had caused the explosion, his mind was the mind that had 
killed the femm he loved, along with himself. For a second, Prowl 
looks blankly at Iron Raptor, but then his head lowers as he feels a 
sharp decrease of trust from her.

She didn't trust him, that was what was going through his mind, but 
she had ever right not to. She had put herself in his arms through 
the merge, and he only accomplished getting her killed, all because 
of one stupid conversation, which led to one stupid thought.

For a second he wondered if he could close his mind to her, hide the 
despair he felt at her feelings, but he knew that he couldn't. This 
was what the Matrix had meant of sharing himself with her, hearing 
her thoughts and feeling her feelings. But the Matrix, the Matrix had 
told him it was not his fault. But it was, he knew that now. If he 
wasn't the one with Iron Raptor through this, perhaps she would have 
come out much easier.

He sighs, stepping back from Iron Raptor. There were no exuses, he 
had failed her, and he could feel the consequences in her very 
thoughts. Perhaps someone else would have done better, someone better 
suited, like Dinobot.. The same feeling of jealousy flares up inside 
Prowl, the Maximal paying no attention to it. Thet thought had done 
all the damage it could.

Prowl was beginning to wish he had never heard that exchange between 
Iris and Iron Raptor. If it only wasn't for that talk.. No, it was 
his fault, and his alone, and he would have to live with it, live 
with the knowledge that through his stupid mistake, through an 
insignificant thought of jealousy, he had killed the femm he loved.

Prowl looks over Iron Raptor like it was the last time he would see 
her. He couldn't feel anything from her now. No love, no hatred, 
nothing, but he was too mixed up in his own emotions: despair, anger 
at himself, sadness, and falure. Yes, he was a falure. He had been 
given a chance with the greatest and most beautiful girl in the 
world, and he blew it, literaly.

The Maximal turns his head away from Iron Raptor, sighing.

"Yea, I guess I did," he mutters, his eyes locking on a flower 
growing out of the ground. It was a prehistoric species, white 
leaves, blue center. White hair and blue skin....





--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> 
> * Iron Raptor looked at her new blue legs as Prowl chuckled at her, 
finding 
> it a bit funny herself. Her laughter rising with his for a moment, 
smiling 
> as she reaches up her hand to take his. But she saw the blush in 
his cheeks, 
> chuckling.*
> 
> " I would say so." * But even those words didn't pay the fact no 
credit, 
> Prowl had done something remarkable for her that she doubted could 
happen 
> just often. And she was very proud and very thankful for him.
> But Iron Raptor simply smiled as Prowl leaned down to kiss her, 
though 
> seeing him stop when she asked him her question. Suddenly blinking 
a few 
> times as thoughts, not her own, come into her mind.
> Prowl...had been jelouse...and then a setting in the spark had gone 
> wrong...and then the sparks had detonated.
> Iron Raptors eyes snapping up to Prowl, not exactly knowing what to 
think 
> but just nodded at his words.
> 
> She then pulled herself up, wabbly on her legs and bracing herself 
with her 
> arms against Prowls chest. Still not quite believing just what she 
had seen, 
> looking at Prowl. Her voice was soft, but a little hurt.*
> 
> " You killed us...."
> 
> * In her mind, the trust that she had felt as the merge began was 
gone, she 
> perhaps trusted him now, but doubted the trust that she had felt 
for him 
> before.*
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
